author: m.kalinin
content:
Applicaiton-layer network stack will be also responsible for retrieving the chain history as it is today. Moving this responsibility to the consensus-layer would require additional API between consensus and application layers which would allow to grab a headers, bodies and receipts upon requests from the wire. Then the reasonable question is, why do we even need the application chain to exists and the answer is existing JSON-RPC API and history and chain structure invariants. This all is a big chunk of research and experiments.

I would not start working on moving transaction pool from devp2p (app) to libp2p (consensus) if there are no further plans and possibilities to get rid of app-layer network stack at all. This all would be really great and that was originally discussed in the merge context. But apparently have a big scope of work to be done.
